ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of Chinese culture, novels, and writers
I gained a lot of insight into modern Chinese literature, different literary styles, and themes.
I now understand more about contemporary Chinese Fiction
Read a lot about Chinese fiction and know more about that historical period
I learned about a lot of the foundations of Modern Chinese literature, as well as advanced reading and writing skills.
Developed the ability to analyze Chinese literature

I learned a lot about traditional Chinese values and it was really great finally being able to articulate the reasons why I was brought up the way I was/develop a better understanding of the culture I grew up in and am a apart of.

The different traditions, schools of thoughts within modern Chinese literature, famous authors and their styles, and how the main themes reflect Chinese society at the time which was going through a lot of turmoil and western influence. Also learned creative writing in Chinese and had to read in both simplified and traditional.
I learned SO much about all the authors we read about.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The novels in the course are very exciting. Prof. Su's explanation of the text and Chinese culture is very interesting.

Strength: the readings are exciting, reflecting the historical backgrounds of the time.

Weakness: There are too many vocab quizzes.
I wish there can be more discussion
Professor Su is so interesting and engaging and has a great knowledge of literature.
There were many Chinese heritage speakers in the class and so it felt very intimidating as a non-native speaker.

The biggest strength is probably that most of the readings we read were in their complete form rather than excerpts. All readings were very interesting and easy to stay on top of and assignments are very chill. There really isn't any weakness to this course.
Professor Su is one of the best Yale professors. I cant think of any weaknesses of this course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to students who are interested in Chinese novels and traditional Chinese culture. Professor Su is a very good lecturer.
Absolutely would recommend. The stories we read are profoundly fascinating and the experience of writing my own stories was surprisingly rewarding.
Yes, because I've never read contemporary Chinese fiction before, and this class opened my eyes.
Yes. The teacher Su is so nice and helpful!
Yes! Especially if you are interested in a challenging Chinese upper level course.
Yes its very informative and gives a great background of chinese literature and philosophy
Yes!

Take it! It's so good. Prof. Su is an excellent teacher and lecturer. He is so enthusiastic and has so much to offer to the class from his own experience as a Chinese author. The readings are not long at all and the assignments are very easy. You not only learn about Chinese literature but also Chinese traditions and philosophy. You won't regret taking it.
YES!!! Professor Su is so encouraging and so insightful.
